senses.ex: She has acquired a good knowledge of English.

Tips.title: Active Acquisition
Tips.description: Acquire often implies active effort in getting something.
Tips.example: He worked hard to acquire the funds needed.

Tips.title: Possession Change
Tips.description: It suggests gaining new possession or obtaining ownership.
Tips.example: They acquired the land for development.

senses.de: to gradually develop something such as a skill or knowledge
senses.ex: By playing the piano every day, she acquired a good sense of rhythm.

Tips.title: Gradual Process
Tips.description: Skills or knowledge usually take time to acquire.
Tips.example: Learning to code is a skill you acquire over time.

Tips.title: Personal Growth
Tips.example: She acquired great patience in caring for her sibling.

senses.de: to buy or take over a company
senses.ex: The company was recently acquired by a larger corporation.

Tips.title: Business Expansion
Tips.description: In business, acquiring often means expanding through purchases.
Tips.example: Our company is looking to acquire a smaller startup.

Tips.title: Strategic Move
Tips.description: Acquisitions are strategic business decisions, not casual buys.
Tips.example: The acquisition was a strategic move for the conglomerate.

senses.ex: He acquired a reputation for being unfairly critical.

Tips.title: Earned Reputation
Tips.description: Acquiring can involve receiving recognition for efforts.
Tips.example: The artist acquired fame after her recent exhibition.

Tips.title: Merited Awards
Tips.description: Use 'acquire' to imply a deserved achievement.
Tips.example: He acquired his third award for scientific research.

senses.ex: Students need to acquire the necessary skills for their future jobs.

Tips.title: Education Focus
Tips.description: Acquire in education often means gaining understanding.
Tips.example: To solve complex problems, one must acquire critical thinking skills.

Tips.title: Discovery Aspect
Tips.description: It can mean discovering knowledge for oneself.
Tips.example: Through research, he acquired insights into the disease.

Achieve.wordDefinition:
Achieve means to successfully reach a goal or complete a task through effort and hard work. For example, you can achieve good grades by studying regularly.

Achieve refers to reaching a specific goal, while acquire refers to gaining something, whether it be knowledge or possessions.

Attain.wordDefinition:
Attain means to achieve or reach a goal. For example, you might attain a high score on a test by studying hard, or attain a promotion at work by performing well and showing leadership.

Both acquire and attain involve obtaining something, but acquire usually refers to obtaining a physical or tangible object, while attain usually refers to achieving a goal or accomplishment through effort or hard work.

Earn.wordDefinition:
The difference between the words acquire and earn is that acquire means to obtain something through various means such as purchasing, receiving as a gift, or inheritance, while earn means to gain something through hard work, effort or achievement.

However, someone earns a promotion at work by working hard and proving his/her worth to the company. Acquire is usually used when you get something without necessarily working hard to get it, while earn is used when you have to work hard to get something you deserve.

Gain.wordDefinition:
The words acquire and gain both mean to obtain or get something.

However, acquire usually implies that you have obtained something through effort or a deliberate action, whereas gain can imply that you have obtained something without much effort or by chance.

For example, you might acquire a new skill by practicing and studying, while you might gain a few pounds by eating too much.

Another example is that a company might acquire another company through a merger or acquisition, while an individual might gain a new friend by striking up a conversation.

Acquire is used when talking about intentionally obtaining something that requires effort, while gain is used when talking about obtaining something through circumstances or happenstance.

Obtain.wordDefinition:
Both acquire and obtain mean to gain or get something.

Obtain is used when you gain something through a more passive or straightforward means. For example, you can obtain a driver's license by passing a test.

Acquire implies more effort or work put in to gain something, while obtain implies a more routine or easy process of gaining something.

Procure.wordDefinition:
Procure means to obtain something through specific means, mainly through formal or official channels.

For example, in business, procurement is a term used for the process of obtaining goods and services from suppliers. It's also used when obtaining something difficult to find or illegal, like drugs, weapons, or stolen goods.

Acquire can be used for anything you gain, while procure means to obtain something through an official or specific process.

Receive.wordDefinition:
Acquire and receive both mean to get something, but there is a slight difference in their usage.

Receive means to be given something, often without effort. For example, you might receive a gift or receive an email.

It can also mean to be affected by something, such as when you receive a diagnosis from a doctor.

- Receive = be given or affected by something

Secure.wordDefinition:
Secure means to make sure something is safe or protected. For example, you might secure your bike with a lock so that no one can steal it, or you might secure your home with an alarm system to prevent break-ins.

So, in general, acquire is used when talking about obtaining something, while secure is used when talking about making sure something is safe or protected.

videos.Text: And it's not just necessities like water. When it comes to most things, the more of it you acquire, the less useful or enjoyable every additional bit becomes. This is the law of diminishing marginal utility. You might gladly buy two or three helpings of your favorite food, but the fourth would make you nauseated,

quotes.Text: Freedom conceives that the mind and spirit of man can be free only if he be free to pattern his own life, to develop his own talents, free to earn, to spend, to save, to acquire property as the security of his old age and his family.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Herbert Hoover

quotes.Text: The personal right to acquire property, which is a natural right, gives to property, when acquired, a right to protection, as a social right.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: James Madison

quotes.Text: Nothing jazzes me up like football. I've acquired more passion of the years, not less. Not to love it wouldn't make sense.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: John Madden

quotes.Text: I don't spend my life making money to spend tomorrow, or to acquire possessions.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Orson Bean

quotes.Text: Mother's love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Erich Fromm

quotes.Text: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: R. Buckminster Fuller

quotes.Text: Before we acquire great power we must acquire wisdom to use it well.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.Text: Every athlete acquires routines as a way to help control nerves.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Hope Solo

quotes.Text: Wisdom is not acquired save as the result of investigation.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Sara Teasdale

quotes.Text: Not by age but by capacity is wisdom acquired.
quotes.Title: Roman Playwright
quotes.Name: Plautus
